basics.name: ROBERT BEGG
basics.label: SENIOR SOFTWARE DEVELOPMENT LEADER
basics.summary: Build World-Class Development Teams | Deliver Quality Products | Drive Efficiency & Growth. Motivate, coach, and empower people, fostering collaborative problem-solving that leads to groundbreaking innovation. Leverage cross-functional insights to connect dots and implement novel, high-impact solutions that align best-fit technologies with core business goals. Demystify technology for audiences at all levels of organizations. Develop strategies that balance product delivery with risk containment, forming clear actionable steps that incrementally enhance user experience and deliver business value to customers.

work.name: CHEMELEX (Formerly nVent)
work.summary: Directed technical design and execution for all software development team deliveries. Reported to Vice President of Research and Development (R&D), managing 95 software engineers, architects, and managers. Worked closely with product management to deliver industrial design and control software in support of core electrical solutions business.
highlights: Built full stack software team of 75 in Mumbai, India, developing in-house expertise with 4X productive capacity.
Delivered appliance-based industrial internet of things (IoT) pipeline predictive monitoring product, achieving first product with annual revenue stream.
Replaced obsolete Windows-based industrial controller management with API-first industrial IoT solution based on Linux appliances, enabling cloud-based digital-twin services.
Collaborated with electronics / firmware team creating integrated physical and virtual system testing automation platform, resulting in 10X increase in test case execution.

Drove strategy to migrate legacy internal electrical design tools and decades of client project data to centralized scalable solution hosted on Amazon Web Services (AWS), enabling 50% reduction in project engineering costs and 30% increase in revenue from change orders.

Established machine learning (ML) team to develop models for thermal dynamics product data, accelerating testing and laying groundwork for strategic artificial intelligence (Al) based product features.

work.name: DELL EMC
work.summary: Provided technical leadership for global team of 80 engineers, delivering advanced automation tools and quality assurance (QA) enablement services to 235+ member VPLEX virtualized storage development team across North America and India.
highlights: Deployed virtualized docker version of VPLEX appliance to expand test coverage, enabling discovery of 80% of defects with DevOps infrastructure before testing on constrained product hardware.
Orchestrated creation of dynamic test generator to remove limitations of static test case libraries, allowing data-driven optimization of test case execution.
Swapped 8-week system test cycle for continuous testing and 1-week final validation, accelerating delivery by 7 weeks.
Transformed traditional QA unit into service delivery organization and partnered with peers following acquisition of EMC by Dell.
Supported service organization to provide customer-executed validation test suite, opening potential sales on storage array products not available for in-house testing.

work.name: BLUECAT NETWORKS
work.summary: Oversaw technical execution of approximately 65 engineers across development, QA, and 3rd-level support for 9-year-old startup. Completed significant architectural and process refactoring over multiple releases of physical / virtual network management appliance. Focused on preparing business for eventual successful sale.
highlights: Introduced disciplined Agile development to improve quality and predictability, achieving 6-month turnaround for 64-bit appliance version and doubling releases per year.
Reduced backlog of field defects 75% and eliminated customer reluctance to upgrade with delivery of 3 successive releases with zero upgrade defects.
Applied collaborative leadership techniques to increase level of ownership and innovation across team, making 48-hour security release cycle possible.
